main event: An unidentified flying object was observed via radar in Kassel, Germany, on multiple occasions in the late 1950s.
interesting points: The object was seen visually for about 10 minutes during one observation., One report described the object as large, oval, and flat, luminous in appearance., No photograph was obtained despite multiple sightings., The object was identified by radar but posed no threat to air operations., Observations indicated that the object could possibly be a meteor or balloon.
witness description: observations made through radar and visual means
